      • Configuration

        public Configuration()

        Default parameters are:
        For each class :

      • Configuration

        public Configuration(java.io.File configFile)
              throws InvalidConfigurationException,
                     java.io.IOException,
                     java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                     java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                     java.lang.SecurityException,
                     java.lang.InstantiationException,
                     java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                     java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                     java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Uses the configuration specified in the properties file in parameter. HOW TO BUILD THE .properties FILE See the Default_Implementation/resources/loggerConfig.properties file for details
        Parameters:
        configFile - The configuration file.
        Throws:
        InvalidConfigurationException - If something goes wrong while parsing the config file, or instantiating with the specified parameters.
        java.io.IOException - If a problem occurs while reading the config file.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - If the specified class in the config file is not found
        java.lang.SecurityException - Sometimes, you will not be able to instantiate a new class
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - This exception is raised when there is a bad implementation
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - This exception is raised when there is a bad implementation
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This exception is raised when there is a bad implementation
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - This exception is raised when there is a bad implementation
        java.lang.InstantiationException - This exception is raised when there is a bad implementation

    • Method Detail

      • addTarget

        public void addTarget(java.lang.Class sClass,
                      Target target)
        Adds a target to a class Using it for the first time overwrites the default value
        Parameters:
        sClass - The specified class
        target - The target to add to the specified class

      • setLevel

        public void setLevel(java.lang.Class sClass,
                     ErrorLevel errorLevel)
        Sets the error level for this class.
        If an error level was already specified, it will be overwritten by the new value.
        Parameters:
        sClass - The specified class
        errorLevel - The errorLevel
        See Also:
        ErrorLevel

      • setLayout

        public void setLayout(java.lang.Class sClass,
                      Formator layout)
        Sets the layout for this class.
        If a layout was already specified, it will be overwritten by the new value.
        Parameters:
        sClass - The specified class.
        layout - The layout that will be applied on all targets.
